newsitem.title: GREECE: ECU/DRACHMA TRADES BELOW 309, DEPOS, FORWARDS DOWN.
newsitem.headline: ECU/DRACHMA TRADES BELOW 309, DEPOS, FORWARDS DOWN.

text.p: Ecu/drachma was back on track after a mid-session detour that took it down to 308.35/45 trading around 308.70/80 in late trade, and depos and fx forwards were softer with the drop more pronounced in the short-end of the spectrum, traders said.

"Ecu/drachma is currently around 308.70/80," a foreign bank forex dealer said. "It has been very volatile lately but we have not seen forex outflows. Contrary to that, I would say we have had inflows from abroad."
Money market dealers said depos and implied drachma rates from forex forwards had fallen 10 to 20 basis points in late trade with the short-end having retreated more than the long-end.
"As usually, the market had overshot and interest rates corrected afterwards," said a dealer at a foreign bank.
Interest rates will find their equilibrium after Wednesday's central bank money tender of 14-day funds and banks make their own calculations, said a dealer at a private bank.
Greece raised about 600 billion drachmas from the sale of 12-month T-bills and 200 billion from two-year zeros, dealers said.
"Retail demand was weak but there was strong demand from local banks and foreign investors who exploited arbitrage opportunities," said a banker.
Two-year zero coupon notes at an unchanged gross yield of 10.1 percent and 12-month T-bills at a gross rate of 10.3 percent, down 20 basis points from the previous issue, go on sale today.

"The market expects T-bills to sell very well, perhaps three or four times over expiries of about 300 billion drachmas, and this will soak liquidity out of the market," said a senior dealer at a private bank.
The mark was quoted at 158.70/80 from Tuesday's 158.650 fix, the dollar at 265.22/33 drachmas from 265.040 and the ecu at 308.66/76 from 308.450 drachmas.
